DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Radiation Therapy Surgery Sequence Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Codes for the sequencing of radiation and surgery given as part of the first course of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Radiation Therapy Surgery Sequence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sequencing of radiation and surgery given as part of the first course of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Surgery Sequence Number Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sequence unknown, but both surgery and radiation were given

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sequence unknown, but both surgery and radiation were given
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sequence unknown, but both surgery and radiation were given

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intraoperative radiation with other radiation given before or after surgery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intraoperative radiation with other radiation given before or after surgery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intraoperative radiation with other radiation given before or after surgery

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Radiation both before and after surgery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Radiation both before and after surgery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation both before and after surgery

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No radiation and/or no surgery; unknown if surgery and/or radiation given

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No radiation and/or no surgery; unknown if surgery and/or radiation given
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No radiation and/or no surgery; unknown if surgery and/or radiation given

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Surgery Sequence Number Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
